item.title: Bathroom items dumped, 22nd October
item.description:
A toilet, some cupboards and other diy/ builders waste dumped beside a tree

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 28, Goldney Road, Maida Vale, London

item.title: Fast Gas nitrous oxide, 22nd October
item.description:
I don't know who left gas canisters in several boxes on the path between Newhaven Gardens and Penford Gardens last night. I looked it up online, and it seems that nitrous oxide is also known as "laughing gas," and its canisters are often found as litters.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Newhaven Gardens, Well Hall, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Resident parking spaces blocked by builders/deliveries, 22nd October
item.description:
258 Richmond Road builders have supplies and rubbish in residents permit parking bays. 262A Richmond Road have placed bins in road awaiting deliveries. Neither tennants have paid & applied for the 3 bays to be suspended. Urgent action is required.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Richmond Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Temporary repair to zip wire seat, 22nd October
item.description:
Following reports from the public, including a child falling and breaking her wrist, FOCRG inspected this ourselves. According to playground users, the damage has been there for two weeks. We have trimmed the flapping bits of plastic off. The seat is still bolted firmly and children are still using it. However we are concerned that regular safety inspections of playground equipment seem to be less frequent now and repairs are taking longer to be done.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Wirral Wood Close, Elmstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dead fox, broken glass and general litter on footway, 22nd October
item.description:
There's a dead fox by a suitcase half way down the footway next to the HMW flyover. The footway is generally litter filled including broken glass, and overgrown. It doesnt look like it's bÃ¨en cleaned for a while .

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Harrow Manorway, West Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet
